matrix-project.description:
Builds bitstreams with different configurations and tests images on real HW if possible. In case of problems: please contact fabrice_moyen@fr.ibm.com or alexandre.castellane@fr.ibm.com Only AD9V3 card is available for test on Orpington Vivado version used : tests on going for 2019.1 (issue with lsf / RH7)
WARNING : local P9 ocaccel_find_card is used with OC-$CRD prefix
Main Issues : - oc-flash not operational - after flashing the oc-reset doesn't cut the power supply, and FPGA is not refreshed !! Need "Power9 reload routine"
=> hdl_example.NORAM had an issue at config level (same as for CAPI2) to be confirmed => ID are not coherent with SNAP IDs

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for https://github.com/OpenCAPI/oc-accel you want to test.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: OCSE_BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for https://github.com/OpenCAPI/ocse you want to test. (OpenCapi Simulation Engine)

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: VIVADO_CHOICE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Choose the Vivado version to use

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: TEST_ON_HW
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Enable/disable testing on HW (Disabled by default as oc-flash + oc-reset does't work yet => need to reboot to get the code !)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: CARDS_CHOICE
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: list of chosen OpenCAPI cards Example: AD9V3 AD9H3 ADH7 INNOVA2

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: TIMING_LABLIMIT_CHOICE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Choose the TIMING_LABLIMIT parameter. If timing is higher than your choice when doing a make image, the run will failed.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: mopBoxes
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of Montpellier systems available for testing : - orpington: AC922 8335-GTH with two AD9V3s 1 in CAPI2 and 1 OC (it needs defined capimop user with authorized_keys)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: austinBoxes
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of Austin systems available for testing : (Assuming no VPN or jump server is needed to access Austin servers, 9.X.X.X addresses) (it needs defined capimop user with authorized_keys)

matrix-project.combinationFilter: ( ((ACT=~"hls" && HLS=="true")||(ACT=~"hdl" && HDL=="true" )) && ( (CRD_CL=~"AD9V3" && AD9V3=="true") || (CRD_CL=~"INNOVA2" && INNOVA2=="true") || ( CRD_CL=~"AD9H" && (AD9H3=="true"|| AD9H7=="true") && !(ACT=~"DDR") ) ) ) || (ACT=="test" && CRD_CL=="AD9V3")

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash set +x # reduce Jenkins output
echo echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "`date` BUILD START" echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "EXECUTING OpenCAPI IMG FIRST SHELL FROM MOPJENKINS ..." echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "Hostname: `hostname`"; echo "ID: `id`" echo "Working dir is : $PWD" echo
#============================================================================================== # Variables
> export_props.properties NAME=$(echo $GIT_BRANCH| cut -d'/' -f 2 |tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]') # remove origin/ from branch and translate to lowercase PREFIX=$(echo $NAME| cut -d'_' -f 1) # chars up to first '_' identify need for test ACTION_TYPE=$(echo $ACT| cut -d'_' -f 1 |tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]') # get ACTION_TYPE (hls, hld) and translate to uppercase CRD=$(echo $CRD_CL| cut -d'_' -f 1) # chars up to first '_' identify card CL=$(echo $CRD_CL| cut -d'_' -f 2) # chars behind first '_' identify Cloud build
echo "Build with Card=$CRD Action=$ACT Action_type=$ACTION_TYPE CLOUD_build=$CL branch_selected=$BRANCH git_branch=$NAME prefix=$PREFIX test_on_hw=$TEST_ON_HW"
#============================================================================================== # Do not run non-desired cases (action types, actions, cards) # BSKIP stands for board skip
BSKIP=0
if [ "${!ACTION_TYPE}" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi # if ACTION_TYPE="HLS", ${!ACTION_TYPE} is identical to $HLS
Found=0 for c in "${CARDS_CHOICE[@]}" do if [ "$CRD" == "$c" ]; then Found=1 fi done if [ $Found -eq 0 ]; then BSKIP=1; fi # $CRD not in the list $CARDS_CHOICE of chosen cards ==> not running $CRD case #if [ "${!CRD}" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi # if CRD="AD9V3", ${!CRD} is identical to $AD9V3
if [ "$ACT" == "test" ]; then BSKIP=0;fi
echo "action_types (hdl,hls)=$ACTION_TYPE enabled_cards=$CRD BSKIP=$BSKIP"
# Following filtering will stop the current test if not required or not possible # This will lead to a brown colored result meaning : aborted # ASKIP may stand for ACTION skip case "$CRD:$ACT" in * ) C="def ";ASKIP=0;; # def=default esac
echo "card=$CRD action=$ACT case=$C ASKIP=$ASKIP"
#============================================================================================== # Cleaning directories if ACT=test, # else checking $CRD.$ACT.defconfig file existence
echo;echo "***********************************************************"
if [ $ASKIP -eq 0 ] then
case "$ACT" in test ) echo "ACT=test" echo gitnames=`git ls-remote git@github.com:OpenCAPI/oc-accel.git|grep "refs/heads/"|awk '{print $2}'`;RC=$? echo "gitnames= $gitnames"
echo for dir in "/var/jenkins/workspace/OC_IMG_matrix"/*;do if [ -d "$dir" ];then branch="refs/heads/"`basename $dir` if [[ "$gitnames" =~ "$branch" ]];then echo "branch=$branch found in gitnames, keeping dir=$dir" else echo "branch=$branch not found in gitnames, deleting dir=\'$dir\'" rm -rf "$dir" # put in quotes to work for directories with blanks fi else echo "$dir is not a directory, continuing" fi done DSKIP=0;;
* ) echo "Checking oc-accel/defconfig/$CRD.$ACT.defconfig existence" if [ -f oc-accel/defconfig/$CRD.$ACT.defconfig ] then echo " --> OK" DSKIP=0 else echo;echo "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" echo "$CRD.$ACT.defconfig does not exist" echo "Aborting..." echo "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!";echo echo; ls oc-accel/defconfig/ DSKIP=1 fi;; esac echo;echo "defconfig DSKIP=$DSKIP"
#============================================================================================== # Checking enough space is available
echo;echo "***********************************************************" echo "J: Checking enough space is available" #AFSused=`fs lq /afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/CI_ws/OC_SNAP_IMG_matrix/|grep -v Used|awk '{print $4}'|sed 's/%//g'|sed 's/<//g'` diskused=`df -h /var/jenkins/workspace/OC_IMG_matrix|grep -v Used|awk '{print $5}'|sed 's/%//g'|sed 's/<//g'` SSKIP=0;msg="disk usage =${diskused}%"
if (( diskused > 90 ));then msg="ERROR: $msg, stopping additional builds";SSKIP=1 #echo "mail sent to castella : ERROR OpenCAPI AFS space" #mail -s "ERROR: OpenCAPI AFS space SIMULATION is used up to ${diskused}%, stopping additional builds" castella #mail -s "ERROR: AFS space SIMULATION is used up to ${AFSused}%, stopping additional builds" mesnet
elif (( diskused > 70 ));then msg="WARNING: $msg" #echo "mail sent to castella : WARNING OpenCAPI AFS space" #mail -s "WARNING: OpenCAPI AFS space IMAGETEST is used up to ${diskused}%" castella #mail -s "WARNING: AFS space IMAGETEST is used up to ${AFSused}%" mesnet else msg="OK: $msg" fi echo "$msg"
fi # end of if ASKIP
if [ "$ASKIP" == "1" ] || [ "$DSKIP" == "1" ] || [ "$BSKIP" == "1" ] || [ "$SSKIP" == "1" ];then SKIP=1;else SKIP=0;fi
#============================================================================================== # Passing parameters to next script
echo;echo "***********************************************************" echo "J: Forwarding parameters to next script" echo "SKIP=$SKIP" > export_props.properties echo "CRD=$CRD" >> export_props.properties echo "CL=$CL" >> export_props.properties echo "properties forwarded to next shell:" cat export_props.properties echo "***********************************************************" echo

#!/bin/bash
set +x # reduce Jenkins output ulimit -c unlimited # limit core dumps
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "EXECUTING SECOND OpenCAPI SHELL FROM MOPJENKINS ..." echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "SKIP forwarded from previous script = $SKIP" if [ $SKIP -eq 1 ] then echo "SKIP=$SKIP ==> Exiting..." exit 0 #"temporarily setting not available as success ! fi echo "Building with Card=$CRD Action=$ACT CLOUD=$CL"
#============================================================================================== # Variables
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin # python3 needs this path setup export USERHOME=`pwd` export SNAP_ROOT=$USERHOME/oc-accel
TESTBOXES=( ${austinBoxes[*]} ${mopBoxes[*]}) # init array of systems
echo "testboxes now = ${TESTBOXES[@]}"
#echo;echo "********************************************************************************" #echo "J: LSF SETUP ..."
# older setup up to RH6 #export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SERVERDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/etc #export LSF_LIBDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib #export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib #export LSF_BINDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SUBMITTER_OSTYPE=Linux #export LSF_ENVDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/conf #LSF='-P zsort -M 2 -C 2000 -I -n 4 -R type=X86_64 -R span[hosts=1]' # Project, GB_mem, KB_core, #_processors, type of processor
# new setup for RH7 #export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SERVERDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/etc #export LSF_LIBDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/lib #export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/lib #export LSF_BINDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SUBMITTER_OSTYPE=Linux #export LSF_ENVDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/conf #LSF='-P zsort -M 2 -C 2000 -I -n 4 -R type=X86_64 -R osver=rh7 -R span[hosts=1]' # Project, GB_mem, KB_core, #_processors, type of processor
#============================================================================================== # OpenCAPI Simulation Engine (ocse) setup # Should not be used but may be required by ??
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo "J: Getting OpenCAPI Simulation Environment (ocse)..."
echo;echo "Current directory is : $PWD" ls -al
echo;echo "Deleting old ./ocse (OpenCAPI Simulation Engine) directory" rm -rf ocse
# When Lance Thomson makes a mod in his OCSE, we might use a specific branch for test # 2019 Nov 04 he merged the issue_2 into master (removing the debug messages)
echo;echo "Getting (git clone) OpenCAPI Simulation Environment (ocse) branch=$OCSE_BRANCH for card=$CRD..." git clone -b $OCSE_BRANCH https://github.com/OpenCAPI/ocse ocse;echo "git clone OCSE RC=$?"
export OCSE_INSTALL_DIR=${USERHOME}/ocse # ca ne sert à rien on dirait !! echo;echo "Exporting ocse directory as : ${USERHOME}/ocse into snap_env.sh" echo "export OCSE_ROOT=${USERHOME}/ocse" >snap_env.sh
#============================================================================================== # Cleaning previous TL/DL & getting TL:DL zip files
# FAB a vérifier si encore nécessaire. A priori non #echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" #echo "J: Cleaning any previous TL/DL and getting TL/DL zip files" #cd ${SNAP_ROOT} #make clean # to make sure we restart from a blank snap #rm -rf hardware/oc-bip # to make sure we restart from a blank capi-bsp #echo "J: git cloning oc-bip" #git submodule init # to get the oc-bip #git submodule update # collecting the TL/DL definition #echo "J: Getting the zip file for tlx and dlx" #cp -r /afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/cards/$CRD/tlx ./hardware/oc-bip/ #cp -r /afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/cards/$CRD/dlx ./hardware/oc-bip/
#============================================================================================== # Setting up Vivado and Timing value
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Setting up Vivado Version and timing value"
echo "#setup: XILINX_LOCAL_USER_DATA=${XILINX_LOCAL_USER_DATA}, overwrite=no to prevent write access error in XilincTclStore (tclapp:load_apps)" >>snap_env.sh echo "export XILINX_LOCAL_USER_DATA=no" >> snap_env.sh echo " --> For all OPENCAPI cards we run Vivavo $VIVADO_CHOICE and extend Timing trials to 5 runs until we optimise placement..." echo " unless expressly indicated"
cd ${SNAP_ROOT} export VIV_VERSION="$VIVADO_CHOICE" echo "VIVADO version initially set to $VIV_VERSION (please check if we change this later for some specific cards)"
echo "export TIMING_LABLIMIT=\"${TIMING_LABLIMIT_CHOICE}\"" >> snap_env.sh echo "TIMING LIMIT set to ${TIMING_LABLIMIT_CHOICE}"
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Vivado paths & licences server setup ..." export XILINX_ROOT=/opt/Xilinx #export XILINX_ROOT=/afs/bb/proj/fpga/xilinx export XILINXD_LICENSE_FILE=2100@pokwinlic1.pok.ibm.com source $XILINX_ROOT/Vivado/${VIV_VERSION}/settings64.sh
# No cadence setup at MOP #echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" #echo "J: Cadence SETUP ..." #echo "IES_LIBS=$IES_LIBS" #echo "CDS_LIC_FILE=$CDS_LIC_FILE"
#============================================================================================== # Testing POWER servers accessibility if ACT=test and TEST_ON_HW=true, # else making $CRD.$ACT.defconfig
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************"
case $ACT in # select config & compile action "test") echo "J: ACT=$ACT ==> skiping image building";echo
if [ "$TEST_ON_HW" == "true" ]; then
echo "Test on Hardware selected ==> testing POWER servers accessibility:" # Cleaning will occur at this step, remote fw*.bin* files older than $days will be removed days=90;srch="'fw*.bin*'"
for box in "${TESTBOXES[@]}";do echo "----------------------------------------------------" if [[ ${mopBoxes[*]} =~ $box ]] then # $box is a Montpellier server echo -e "MOP : $box -> \c" bindir="/home/capimop/" RC=0;ssh capimop@$box ping localhost -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 || RC=$? else echo -e "AUSTIN: $box -> \c" bindir="/home/capimop/" RC=0;ssh capimop@$box ping localhost -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 || RC=$? fi
if [ $RC == "0" ]; then echo "$box ping ok"; else echo "$box not reachable";continue;fi
echo "Cleaning process : ssh capimop@$box find & delete $srch in $bindir older than $days days" ssh capimop@$box "find $bindir -type f -name $srch -mtime +$days -ls -delete" nusers=`ssh capimop@${box} who|grep -v root|grep -v capimop|wc -l` echo "`date` box=$box nusers=$nusers" done fi exit 0 ;;
*"nvme"*|*"NVME"*) echo "J: ACT=*NVME* ==> SIMULATOR=nosim & Configure image thanks to $CRD.$ACT.defconfig file ...";echo echo "export SIMULATOR=nosim" >> snap_env.sh make -s $CRD.$ACT.defconfig ;;
# In case we would like a FACTORY, we build it using hdl_example.NORAM to ease debug *"hdl_example.NORAM"*) echo "J: ACT=*hdl_example.NORAM* ==> Factory case ?? ..." if [ "$FACTORY" == "true" ];then echo "J: FACTORY=true ==> ENABLE_FACTORY=y & Configure image thanks to $CRD.$ACT.defconfig file...";echo echo "ENABLE_FACTORY=y" >> ./defconfig/$CRD.$ACT.defconfig make -s $CRD.$ACT.defconfig else echo "J: FACTORY=false ==> Doing NOTHING...";echo fi ;;
*) echo "J: Generic case ==> Just configure image thanks to $CRD.$ACT.defconfig file...";echo make -s $CRD.$ACT.defconfig ;; esac
#============================================================================================== # Building image (make image/ make cloud...)
if [ "$CL" == "nCL" ] then
maxloop=5; for loop in `seq 1 $maxloop` do echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: `date` Build Non-Cloud Image (make image) for $CRD, Loop ${loop}/$maxloop" #RC=0; bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_image" "make image" && break || RC=$? RC=0; make image && break || RC=$? done
if [ $RC -eq 0 ] && [ $loop -eq 1 ]; then echo "OK : ${CRD}_${ACT}_image :-make image- : TIMING SUCCEEDED at the first try (loop=$loop)"
elif [ $RC -eq 0 ] && [ $loop -gt 1 ]; then echo "WARNING : ${CRD}_${ACT}_image :-make image- : TIMING SUCCEEDED after $loop loop(s)" #mail -s "WARNING : ${CRD}_${ACT}_image :-make image- : TIMING SUCCEEDED after $loop loop(s)" castella
elif [ $RC -ne 0 ]; then echo "ERROR : ${CRD}_${ACT}_image :-make image- : TIMING FAILED after $maxloop loop(s)" #mail -s "ERROR : ${CRD}_${ACT}_image :-make image- : TIMING FAILED after $maxloop loop(s)" castella exit 1 fi
else # case of Cloud Build # FAB never for the moment but if needed, needs to adapt (BSUB, etc) mkdir -p ${SNAP_ROOT}/hardware/DCPs echo "J: `date` Build Cloud Image ..." echo "export DCP_ROOT=${SNAP_ROOT}/hardware/DCPs/" >> snap_env.sh echo "ENABLE_PRFLOW=y" >> .snap_config echo "ENABLE_CLOUD_USER_FLOW=n" >> .snap_config echo "ENABLE_CLOUD_BUILD_BITFILE=n" >> .snap_config make -s oldconfig echo "J: Build Static Region ..." bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_image" "make cloud_base" || exit echo "J: Build Action Region ..." bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_image" "make cloud_action" || exit echo "J: Merge Static and Action Region ..." echo "ENABLE_CLOUD_BUILD_BITFILE=y" >> .snap_config make -s oldconfig bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_image" "make cloud_merge" || exit fi
#============================================================================================== # Checking generated binaries
# when using a parallel flash we have only 1 binary file # when using a SPI8 flash we have 2 binary files to deal with
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: `date` Checking generated $ACT binaries for $CRD..."
#BINFILES contains binary name (In SPI : "primary and secondary" names) BINFILES=`ls $SNAP_ROOT/hardware/build/Images/oc_[0-9]*.bin|grep -v FACTORY|head -n2` BITFILES=`ls $SNAP_ROOT/hardware/build/Images/oc_[0-9]*.bit|grep -v FACTORY|head -n2`
if [ "$BINFILES" == "" ]; then echo " --> cannot find binary files";exit 1 fi
for f in $BINFILES do size=`ls -al $f | awk '{print $5}'` echo "binfile=$f size=$size" (( size < 100000 )) && die 1 " --> image $f is too small $size to burn" # We assign IMAGE for log purpose, it eventually takes the name of secondary if SPI8 IMAGE="/home/capimop/images/${CRD}/${ACT}/"`basename $f` done
# In FACTORY MODE : We save hdl_example and hls_helloworld bin for cards files for future .mcs generation #case ${ACT}:$FACTORY in # hdl_example.NORAM:true ) # FACTBINFILES=`ls -t $SNAP_ROOT/hardware/build/Images/oc_*[0-9]_FACTORY*.bin` # take FACTORY bin files # Copy hdl_ex Factory files if any # if [ "$FACTBINFILES" == "" ] ; then echo "Cannot find Factory binfile $FACTBINFILES although FACTORY REQUESTED !!";exit 1 # fi # DIR=${CRD}_OC_FACTORY_MCS # mkdir -p /data/Images/${DIR} # SAVE="/data/Images/${CRD}_OC_FACTORY_MCS"; echo "J: FACTORY was requested : copy ${CRD} hdl_example.noram bin files to $SAVE";cp -rp $FACTBINFILES $SAVE;; # hls_helloworld:true ) # SAVE="/data/Images/${CRD}_OC_FACTORY_MCS"; echo "J: FACTORY was requested : copy ${CRD} hls_helloworld bin files to $SAVE";cp -rp $BINFILES $SAVE;; #esac
#============================================================================================== # Testing on POWER Hardware generated binaries
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "J: Testing on POWER Hardware generated binaries (test_on_hw=${TEST_ON_HW} for card=${CRD})"
SaveDir=/data/Images/${CRD}_oc_missing mkdir -p $SaveDir NoTestSaveDir=/data/Images/no_test_required mkdir -p $NoTestSaveDir
# leave uncommented the following line if there is not hardware available at all for the selected card # FAB: Supprimer toute référence de carte en dure dans le script car ajouter une nouvelle carte devient alors hard
case $CRD:${TEST_ON_HW} in
AD9V3:* ) echo " -> No test required, copying $CRD image & bitfile to $SaveDir" cp -rp $BINFILES $SaveDir cp -rp $BITFILES $SaveDir exit 0 ;;
AD9H3:* ) echo " -> No test required, copying $CRD image & bitfile to $SaveDir" cp -rp $BINFILES $SaveDir cp -rp $BITFILES $SaveDir exit 0 ;;
AD9H7:* ) echo " -> No test required, copying $CRD image & bitfile to $SaveDir" cp -rp $BINFILES $SaveDir cp -rp $BITFILES $SaveDir exit 0 ;;
INNOVA2:* ) echo " -> No test required, copying $CRD image to $SaveDir" cp -rp $BINFILES $SaveDir exit 0 ;;
*:false ) echo " -> No test required, copying image to $NoTestSaveDir" cp -rp $BINFILES $NoTestSaveDir exit 0 ;;
esac
# FAB: exit 0 before so END OF JOB ! ###################################################################################################################################### ######################################################################################################################################
# # Set unique target directory such that parallel builds do not disturb each other. # Well, we might to clean up those from time to time ... # TARGET_DIR="${JOB_NAME}-${BUILD_NUMBER}-${GIT_BRANCH}" export TARGET_DIR=`echo $TARGET_DIR | sed -e 's/[=,\/]/-/g'` echo "J: TARGET_DIR=${TARGET_DIR}" echo "J: Current Dir is " `pwd` #echo "************ Parent Job Data **********************************************************" #echo "J: --> PARENT_JOB_NAME: ${PARENT_JOB_NAME}" echo "J: --> JOB_NAME: ${JOB_NAME}" echo "J: --> IMAGE: ${IMAGE}" echo "J: --> CARD_TO_TEST: ${CARD_TO_TEST}" echo "J: --> ACTION: ${ACTION}" echo "J: --> GIT_Branch: ${GIT_BRANCH}" echo "J: --> GIT_Commit: ${GIT_COMMIT}" #echo "************ User Input Data **********************************************************" #echo "J: --> MY_IMAGE: ${MY_IMAGE}" #echo "J: --> MY_CARD: ${MY_CARD}"
echo "***************************************************************************************" RC=0;ssh dim1 ping localhost -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 ||RC=$? if [ $RC == "0" ]; then echo "dim1 ping ok"; else echo "dim1 not pingable";exit 100;fi
echo "testboxes2=${TESTBOXES[@]}"
for box in "${TESTBOXES[@]}";do if [[ ${mopBoxes[*]} =~ $box ]] then # $box is a Montpellier server RC=0;ssh $box ping localhost -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 || RC=$? else # $Box is a Boeblingen server, accessible through dim1 system RC=0;ssh dim1 ping $box -c1 >/dev/null 2>&1 || RC=$? fi
if [ "$RC" == "0" ]; then : echo "$box ping ok"; else for i in "${TESTBOXES[@]}"; do [[ $i != $box ]] && new+=($i);done # generate new test array without unreachable box unset TESTBOXES;TESTBOXES=("${new[@]}");unset new # reassign to original array name echo "$box not pingable, remove from testing, remaining=${TESTBOXES[@]}" if [[ "${TESTBOXES[@]}" == "" ]];then echo "no test machines avail anymore";exit 1;fi fi done # for box
echo "testboxes3=${TESTBOXES[@]}"
function finish { # define function to unlock in case of error, executed after registering with "trap finish EXIT" echo "RC=$?, now unlock ${LOCK} and end" SSH_RC=0;ssh fpga@$box rmdir ${LOCK} || SSH_RC=$? echo "`date` box=$box $LOCK unlock RC=$SSH_RC" } echo "testboxes4=${TESTBOXES[@]}" maxloop=60; echo "Wait (max $maxloop min) for free card=$CRD in ${TESTBOXES[@]}, Iam `whoami`(whoami answer)" for loop in `seq 1 $maxloop`;do for box in "${TESTBOXES[@]}";do nusers=`ssh fpga@${box} who|grep -v root|grep -v fpga|wc -l` # echo "remote homespace content:"; ssh $box ls -al /home/fpga find_card=snap_find_card.${GIT_COMMIT}.`date +%H%M%S`.`basename $BINFILES`
# Potential issue to be solved : # for some reason Joerg was coping the snap_find_card, for the moment, we rely on the local P9 server one (I did ln -s to the local oc-snap dir) # if it has been updated, then we miss the update though !!! # # older CAPI2 manner : # echo "J: copy $find_card to $box:/home/fpga"; # watch out "single_test" need to have this cp done before! # RC=0;scp ./software/tools/snap_find_card fpga@$box:/home/fpga/$find_card ; RC=$? # if # [ "$RC" -gt "0" ];then echo "copy $find_card to $box result : RC=$RC, continue anyway"; # fi # end of older manner
# Checking with local linked (to ~fpga/oc-snap/software/tools/) snap_find_card if we have a $CRD available found=0;cards=`ssh -ttq fpga@${box} /home/fpga/snap_find_card -A OC-${CRD}`||found=$? #found=0;cards=`ssh -ttq fpga@${box} /home/fpga/$find_card -A ${CRD}`||found=$? #SSH_RC=0;ssh -ttq fpga@${box} rm /home/fpga/$find_card || SSH_RC=$? #echo "J: `date` removed $find_card ./from $box RC=$SSH_RC" hours=`date +%H` echo "J: `date` loop=$loop box=$box nusers=$nusers card=$CRD snap_find_card found=$found" case $found:$nusers in 0:*) # echo "no card avail, try other box"; if [ $box == ${TESTBOXES[*]:(-1)} ];then echo "wait...";sleep 60;fi continue;; [1234]:0) # echo "card avail, no user, now lock & test" for cardid in $cards;do LOCK="jenkins_lock_card"$cardid RC=0;ssh $box "mkdir ${LOCK} 2>/dev/null"||RC=$? if [ $RC == "0" ]; then : echo "J: `date` box=$box $LOCK lock RC=$RC"; trap finish EXIT # register finish/unlock function, after lock is set break 3 else echo "J: box=$box $LOCK already locked, try next card" fi done;; *:0) echo "J: unknown found_RC=$found from snap_find_card=$cards"; exit 100;; *) if (( 9<=hours && hours<=19 ));then echo "J: hours=$hours, nusers=$nusers, try other box" if [ $box == ${TESTBOXES[*]:(-1)} ];then echo "wait...";sleep 60;fi continue else ssh fpga@${box} who|grep -v root|grep -v fpga echo "J: hours=$hours, nusers=$nusers, now lock & notify & test" for cardid in $cards;do LOCK="jenkins_lock_card"$cardid RC=0;ssh $box "mkdir ${LOCK} 2>/dev/null"||RC=$? if [ $RC == "0" ]; then : echo "J: `date` box=$box $LOCK lock RC=$RC"; trap finish EXIT # register finish/unlock function, after lock is set ssh $box wall "WARNING: JENKINS TEST on FPGA CARD=$CRD ID=$cards" break 3 else echo "J: box=$box $LOCK already locked, try next card" fi done fi;; esac done # for box done #for loop if [ "$loop" == "$maxloop" ];then DIR=${CRD}_oc_card_not_avail mkdir -p /data/Images/${DIR} SAVE="/data/Images/${CRD}_card_not_avail" echo "no card avail, copy image to $SAVE" cp -rp $BINFILES $SAVE exit 100 fi
ssh fpga@${box} "echo ------ START of JOB on $box ---->> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "date >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "echo JOB_NAME : $JOB_NAME >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "echo Card : $CRD[$cardid] >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "echo Image : $IMAGE >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "echo Build No : ${BUILD_NUMBER} >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "echo Git Branch: ${GIT_BRANCH} >> jenkins.log"
trap finish EXIT # register finish/unlock function, after lock is set
echo "Running on $box :ls -al" ssh $box ls -al
# CAPI2 for memory : #echo "J: Copy workspace ${TARGET_DIR} to ${box}" #RC=0;rsync -az --delete . fpga@${box}:${TARGET_DIR} ; RC=$?
echo "J: Preparing oc-snap workspace by cloning git@github.ibm.com:OC-Enablement/oc-snap.git into ${TARGET_DIR} at ${box} and selecting ${GIT_BRANCH} as a branch" RC=0; ssh fpga@${box} "git clone git@github.ibm.com:OC-Enablement/oc-snap.git ${TARGET_DIR};cd ${TARGET_DIR};git checkout ${GIT_BRANCH}" || RC=$?
#Fab #RC=0 #Fab #ssh $box ls -a |grep -Fx snap #Fab #if [ ! $(ssh $box "ls -a |grep -Fx snap") == "snap" ];then #Fab #echo "J: on remote $box, snap dir not existing, cloning it" #Fab #ssh $box git clone http://github.com/open-power/snap.git;RC=$? #Fab #else #Fab #echo "on remote $box, snap dir exists, git pull to update it" #Fab #echo "TO DO : need to select proper branch .... working on master for the moment" #Fab #ssh $box "cd snap;git pull";RC=$? #Fab #fi
if [ "$RC" -gt "0" ];then SAVE="/data/Images/rsync_error";echo "git clone git@github.ibm.com:OC-Enablement/oc-snap.git ${TARGET_DIR} failed at ${box}, copy image to $SAVE"; cp -rp $BINFILES $SAVE echo "=>exit with RC=100" exit 100 fi
echo "J: COPY Image(s) $BINFILES to $IMAGE on $box" ssh $box mkdir -p /home/fpga/images/${CRD}/${ACT} # create subdirectory, if not avail yet
COUNT_IMAGE=0 # Modification to support SPI dual files cases for f in $BINFILES do IMAGE[$COUNT_IMAGE]="/home/fpga/images/${CRD}/${ACT}/"`basename $f` echo "J: COPY Image $f to ${IMAGE[$COUNT_IMAGE]} on fpga@$box" RC=0;rsync -tvh $f fpga@$box:${IMAGE[$COUNT_IMAGE]} ; RC=$? if [ "$RC" -gt "0" ];then SAVE="/data/Images/rsync_error";echo "rsync error, copy image to $SAVE"; cp -rp $f $SAVE exit 100 fi COUNT_IMAGE=`expr $COUNT_IMAGE + 1` # Modification to support SPI dual files cases done
echo "J: BIN Files Transfered to $box ..." echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "" # ssh fpga@${box} lsb_release -a
echo "J: Preparing command ..." RUN="sudo ./actions/scripts/oc_snap_jenkins.sh" #sudo used to get access to /dev/ocxl/IBM,oc-snap.... directory if [ ! -f $RUN ];then echo "J: `date` Shell Script $RUN not found,Exit UNSTABLE"; exit 100 fi RUN+=" -D ${TARGET_DIR}"
#AC adding SPI8 Variable SPI8=0 case $CRD in "AD9V3") SPI8=1;; *) SPI8=0;; esac #AC adding SPI8 Variable
echo "J: Card=$CRD and SPI8=$SPI8" if [ $SPI8 -eq 0 ];then # Preparing Command to be run on $box : if [ -z ${IMAGE} ];then RUN+=" -A ALL";else RUN+=" -F ${IMAGE} -A ${CRD} -C $cardid";fi else # Preparing Command to be run on $box : if [ -z ${IMAGE} ];then RUN+=" -A ALL";else RUN+=" -F ${IMAGE[0]} -f ${IMAGE[1]} -A ${CRD} -C $cardid";fi fi
echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "J: Build the software and actions on $box in $TARGET_DIR ..." RC=0;ssh $box make -C ${TARGET_DIR} clean software actions || exit 100 echo "" echo "J: Make finished on $box in $TARGET_DIR ..." echo "***************************************************************************************" echo "" echo "J: `date` Executing this SNAP JENKINS TEST on $box from ${TARGET_DIR} directory:" echo "J: =>$RUN" RC=0;ssh -T fpga@${box} << EOF || RC=$? export TERM=xterm cd ${TARGET_DIR} pwd set -f ${RUN} EOF
# Write short log only, Clean workspace # Note: this lines in the log file and the lines above can be ssh fpga@${box} "echo Exit: $JOB_NAME RC = $RC at:\ >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "date >> jenkins.log" ssh fpga@${box} "echo ----------- EXIT ------------------->> jenkins.log"
#DEBUG !! #echo "J: `date` Clean up ${TARGET_DIR} on ${box}" echo "J: `date` DEBUG : DO NOT Clean up ${TARGET_DIR} on ${box}" #ssh -T fpga@${box} rm -rf ${TARGET_DIR}
if [ 0 -ne $RC ]; then echo "J: `date` Test failed RC = $RC, exit UNSTABLE" exit 100 fi
